chapters.summary: This chapter explains different types of numbers like natural, whole, integers, rational, irrational, and real numbers. It also teaches decimal expansions and laws of exponents.
student_explanation: Natural numbers are counting numbers.
Whole numbers include zero.
Integers include positive and negative whole numbers.
Rational numbers can be expressed as p/q.
Irrational numbers cannot be expressed as p/q.
Real numbers include both rational and irrational numbers.

key_definitions.definition: All positive and negative whole numbers.
Numbers in p/q form with q ≠ 0.

chapters.summary: This chapter introduces polynomials, their degrees, zeroes, remainder theorem, factor theorem, and identities.
student_explanation: A polynomial is an expression made of variables and constants.
Degree is the highest power of the variable.
Zero of polynomial is value that makes p(x)=0.
Identities help expand and simplify expressions.

key_definitions.definition: Expression in x with non-negative integer powers.

important_points: A polynomial of degree n has at most n zeroes.
Factor theorem connects zeroes and factors.

chapters.summary: Learn how to represent points in a plane using ordered pairs. Introduction to Cartesian system.
student_explanation: Every point is represented as (x, y).
x-axis is horizontal and y-axis is vertical.
Point where axes meet is called origin.
Quadrants show sign patterns.

key_definitions.definition: Plane formed by two perpendicular axes.

chapters.summary: You learn to solve equations with two variables and plot them on graphs.
student_explanation: Linear equation has two variables x and y.
Every solution is a pair of values that satisfies equation.

key_definitions.definition: Equation of form ax + by + c = 0.

important_points: Graph of linear equation is a straight line.

chapters.summary: Introduction to Euclid’s axioms, postulates, and foundational definitions.
student_explanation: Geometry is based on logical reasoning.
Euclid defined basic geometric objects.

postulates: A straight line can join two points.
A circle can be drawn with any radius.

chapters.summary: Learn basic terms related to lines and study different types of angles.
student_explanation: Angles form when two rays meet.
Vertically opposite angles are equal.
Linear pair makes 180°.
Corresponding and alternate angles appear in parallel lines.

key_definitions.definition: Part of line with two endpoints.

important_points: Sum of angles on a straight line is 180°.
Alternate interior angles are equal (parallel lines).

chapters.summary: Study triangle properties and congruence criteria.
student_explanation: Triangles have 3 sides and 3 angles.
Congruent triangles have same shape and size.

key_definitions.definition: Triangles with equal sides and angles.

important_points: Sum of angles in a triangle = 180°.
SAS, ASA, SSS, RHS are congruence criteria.

chapters.summary: Study parallelogram properties and mid-point theorem.
student_explanation: Quadrilateral has 4 sides.
Opposite sides of parallelogram are equal.
Diagonals bisect each other.
important_points: Opposite angles of parallelogram are equal.

formulas_and_identities.midpoint_theorem: Line through midpoints of two sides is parallel to third side.

chapters.summary: Understand chords, arcs, angles in a circle, and cyclic quadrilaterals.
student_explanation: Circle is set of points equidistant from center.
Equal chords make equal angles.
Angles in same segment are equal.

key_definitions.definition: Line joining two points on circle.

important_points: Opposite angles of cyclic quadrilateral add to 180°.

formulas_and_identities.arc_angle_relation: Angle at center = 2 × angle at circumference

chapters.summary: Learn to find area of triangle using Heron's formula.
student_explanation: Use semi-perimeter to find area.
Useful when height is unknown.

chapters.summary: Learn formulas for spheres and cones for both surface area and volume.
student_explanation: Curved surface area is different from total surface area.
Volume measures 3D space occupied.
important_points: Sphere has no edges or vertices.
Cone has circular base and pointed top.

chapters.summary: Learn graphical representation of data and basic features of statistics.
student_explanation: Statistics deals with data collection and representation.
Bar graphs help visualize frequency clearly.

formulas_and_identities.mean_formula: Mean = Sum of observations / Number of observations
